thread.title: Matt Damon blamed for Oscars Best Picture mix-up as fans confuse him with lookalike accountant Brian Cullinan
thread.title_full: Matt Damon blamed for Oscars Best Picture mix-up as fans confuse him with lookalike accountant Brian Cullinan

author: Vicki Newman
title: Matt Damon blamed for Oscars Best Picture mix-up as fans confuse him with lookalike accountant Brian Cullinan
text:
Matt Damon has found himself being blamed for the Oscars Best Picture mix-up - and no, it's not Jimmy Kimmel taking a dig this time. 
Bungling millionaire accountant Brian Cullinan - who is even described as a Damon lookalike on the PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) website - was one of two people with briefcases containing the infamous winners envelopes. 
Due to a "human error", La La Land was wrongly announced as the winner of the Best Picture prize, before it was revealed Moonlight had actually won. Brian Cullinan of PwC holding the winners envelopes (Photo: Rex Features) Could it have just been Matt Damon? (Photo: Getty Images North America) 
Now, people have joked that Damon's long-running fake feud with Oscars host Jimmy Kimmel - and his newfound doppelganger - mean he could have been involved. 
"Anyone else think @briancullinan_ and #MattDamon look alike? I think #envelopegate was to sabotage @jimmykimmel," one fan teased. 
Meanwhile, after the biggest ever gaffe in the history of the Oscars, Matt Damon has said "that's what they get for hiring Jimmy Kimmel". 
The actor jokingly pointed the finger of blame at the talk show host, who took the reigns at the 89th Academy Awards on Sunday. 
Jimmy repeatedly mocked the Martian star during the ceremony at Los Angeles Dolby Theatre and Matt has continued their long-running fake feud by saying it was his fault that La La Land was wrongly announced as Best Picture when it was in fact Moonlight. Read More Oscars accountant responsible for biggest gaffe in Academy Awards history 'tweeted picture of Emma Stone minutes before mix-up' Jimmy Kimmel and Warren Beatty laugh after correcting the Best Picture Oscar (Photo: REUTERS) 
The 46-year-old actor joked to Entertainment Tonight after the ceremony: "I was the one person who wasn't surprised that it all got screwed up. That's what they get for hiring Jimmy. You know, they got what they paid for." 
Jimmy, 49, couldn't resist taking shots at his weight, career choices and lack of success during his stint at the helm of the prestigious ceremony. 
In his opening monologue, he said: "Tonight, in spirit of healing and bringing people together, I would like to bury the hatchet with someone I've had issues with. I would. Matt Damon. 
"I've known Matt for a long time now. I've known Matt so long, when I first met Matt, I was the fat one, OK? It's true. And we've had problems. He's a selfish person. Matt says "they got what they paid for" when they hired Jimmy (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
